p: The leaf essential oil of C. infectoria was rich in the germacrene sesquiterpenes germacrene D (55.5%) and bicyclogermacrene (11.4%), and these compounds may be responsible for the larvicidal activity. Germacrene D has demonstrated notable larvicidal activity against Ae. aegypti and Cx. quinquefasciatus (LC 50 = 18.8 and 21.3 μg/mL, respectively) [ 46], and bicyclogermacrene was larvicidal against Ae. albopictus and Cx. tritaeniorhynchus (LC 50 = 11.1 and 12.5 μg/mL, respectively) [ 47].
